intro: Ectinocladus, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plants are typically found in coastal areas and saline environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Ectinocladus species often have a short, robust stem with alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. These plants play an important role in stabilizing dunes and preventing erosion in coastal ecosystems.
